modules.description: This module enables the creation and configuration of Dune build stanzas, including rules, executables, libraries, and install operations, with support for conditional logic and dependency management. It manipulates Dune DSL representations, such as build targets, dependencies, actions, and virtual library relationships, to construct structured OCaml project configurations. Specific use cases include defining module ordering, preprocessing rules, compilation flags, and customizing file installations or virtual library implementations.

Provides functions to serialize and deserialize Dune DSL structures into human-readable formats, supporting lists, tuples, and custom record types. Operates on OCaml types generated from Dune's syntax definitions, including build rules and target specifications. Used to generate debug outputs and configuration previews during build system analysis.

Manages Dune build configurations by defining stanzas, dependencies, and actions, with support for conditional logic and custom installations. It processes a JSON structure containing parameter sets used in Mustache templates, allowing for dynamic configuration generation. Operations include setting up build targets, managing module dependencies, and configuring installation rules. Examples include generating build files with custom flags, defining virtual libraries, and applying preprocessing steps based on parameterized inputs.
